I am directed by Mr. Secretary Eden to request you to inform the Secretary of State for India that he has had under consideration, at the request of the Comptroller and Auditor- General and His Majesty’s Treasury, the question of the production of bank certificates by consular officers in resnect of ^.ny balances of funds obtained by them direct from the Government of India in advance of expenditure to be incurred on behalf of that government. 2. It has been decided, if the Secretary of State for India concurs, to instruct consular officers who hold such balances on account of the Government of India to furnish to that government a bank certificate, together with the officer’s own certificate in respect of cash held in the office, showing the balance held on the last day of each quarter. 3. The bank certificate will be in the form of a statement by the consulate bankers showing all balances of consular funds in their custody on the prescribed date, under separate headings one of which will relate to the funds of the Government of India. 4. In view of the lapse of time which would occur if notification of such balances were to be made through the Foreign Office, it appears desirable that the relevant certificates The Under-Secretary of State, India Officecertificates should be sent by consular officers direct to the Government of India. 5. The arrangements now contemplated will not apply to cases in v/hich expenditure is met in the first instance from Foreign Office funds, against recovery by the consular officer or the Foreign Office from the Government of India or from your department. 6 . Mr. Eden would suggest that the Government of India should be informed of the proposed instructions, so that they may be in a position to call for any certificates inadvertently omitted from the statements of account rendered by consular officers in regard to the expenditure for which funds have been supplied by that government. 7. titleInfo.title: PZ 6755/37 'Consular: Funds held by H.M. Consular Officers on behalf of the Government of India'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 22; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of correspondence regarding a proposal for the certification of cash balances held by HM Consular Officers on behalf of the Government of India. This covers scenarios where consular officers obtained funds directly from the Government of India in advance of expenditure to be incurred on behalf of the Government. The proposal and arrangements for certification are discussed.Correspondents include: the Foreign Office; India Office; Dominions Office; Colonial Office; and the Government of India, External Affairs Department.The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
